intro: Lactuca alatipes, commonly known as the winged lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the dandelion family. It is native to the eastern United States and thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. The plant features a rosette of lance-shaped, hairy leaves that are often tinged with purple at the base. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. The plant is sometimes considered a weed but has historical uses in traditional medicine.
